revised_title: Observations of a Planetary Nebula in Malta
tldr: William Lassell observed a planetary nebula in Malta using a large equatoreal telescope. He discovered a brilliant elliptic ring within the nebula, which was well-defined and had no connection with the surrounding gaseous envelope. The ring's form is either elliptic or circular, seen in a line nearly perpendicular to its plane. Lassell's observations suggest that more gorgeous systems may exist beyond our view.
